publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Maroccus extaticus. Or, Bankes bay horse in a trance : A discourse set downe in a merry dialogue, betweene Bankes and his beast: anatomizing some abuses and bad trickes of this age. Written and intituled to mine host of the Belsuage, and all his honest guests. By Iohn Dando the wierdrawer of Hadley, and Harrie Runt, head ostler of Bosomes Inne
monogr.author: Dando, John

div.head: THE AVTHORS to the Reader.
div.p:
SO Marocco dyd lye him downe, and Laurence Holden cald in his guest vnto a shoulder of mutton of the best in the market, piping hot from the spit. We like two lazie fellowes laie tumbling in the hayloft, and heard this that we haue set down verbatim, aswel as we could: and will watch narrowly but we wil seize the rest to our vse▪ gentle Reader, whensoeuer it comes vpon them. For by Maroccos conclusion, this Dialog shoulde seeme but an Induction
to another discourse, which how vnpleasant so euer it proue, to a great many, we know, that haue beene wrong on the withers, and stong with the marchants booke, it will be reasonably friendly and welcome.

closer.signed: quoth Iohn Dando and Harry Runt.
